eligibility.weHaveAFewQuestions: We have a few questions for you to help get us started.

eligibility.enterNumber: Please enter your mobile number to create your personal account. You will receive an SMS message to confirm your number (data rates may apply).
eligibility.numberDisclaimer: Your number will be stored securely and separate from your data. It will not be shared with anyone. We will not keep your number if you decide not to join the study.
eligibility.pleaseReview: Please review your answers to ensure they are correct.

firstCommonConsent.toJoinTheStudy: To join the study you need to give your consent. The next screens will explain the study and help you decide if you want to join.
firstCommonConsent.weWillAskYou: We will ask you questions as you go to make sure that we do a good job telling you about the study.
firstCommonConsent.weWantToLearn: Together, we will learn how young people want to share information with researchers on their emotional health. We want to learn from you:
firstCommonConsent.section1: What information are you willing to share with researchers about your emotional health?
firstCommonConsent.section2: How much control do you want over how your information is collected, managed, or used by researchers?

section3.section1: We  will gather this information from thousands of young people across the world. We will use it to build a program where young people can learn from each other how  to manage their emotional health. This study is being conducted by a team of scientists in South Africa, India, the United Kingdom, and the United States. You can learn more about our

firstCommonConsent.whatWillYouAsk: What will you ask me to do?
firstCommonConsent.step1: 1. Download and install the free MindKind Study App on your phone.
firstCommonConsent.step2: 2. Use the app to answer general questions about yourself - this should take about 15 minutes.
firstCommonConsent.step3: 3. Use the app to record your mental and emotional wellbeing for 3 months - less than 10 minutes a day.
firstCommonConsent.dataCollectionEncrypted: Your data will be encrypted and transferred to a secure cloud server in the U.S.
firstCommonConsent.dataCollectionIdentity: Your identity will not be stored with your data.
firstCommonConsent.dataCollectionCombined: Your study data, without your name, will be combined with data from other people in the study.
firstCommonConsent.yourRights: You have rights when it comes to your data:
firstCommonConsent.requestData: You can request a copy of your study data.
firstCommonConsent.correctData: You can ask us to correct information about you that is incorrect.
firstCommonConsent.ifCitizenEU: If you are a resident of a nation that abides by the General Data Protection Regulations, click here to
firstCommonConsent.ifCitizenEULink: learn more about your data rights.
firstCommonConsent.shareDatawithMindKind: Data you share with us when you use the MindKind Study app.
firstCommonConsent.dataPermission: Data you give us permission to collect directly from your phone, like screen time and step count.
firstCommonConsent.notSharePhoneData: If you don’t want to share data from your phone with us that’s okay - you can still participate in the study.
firstCommonConsent.dataDisclaimer: We will NEVER collect your exact location, your photos, emails, texts, calls, or what you say or type outside of the app.

armOne.title: How will your study data be used?
armOne.subTitle: Your study data will be part of a global databank for researchers. Researchers will download study data from the databank.
armOne.subText1: Researchers from all over the world will be using this study data to investigate all kinds of topics and make discoveries. If new tests, drugs, or other commercial products result from these studies, you will not get any profits.

pageOne.title: How will researchers view your data?
pageOne.correctAnswer: Correct! Researchers will download the study data which includes a copy of your data.
pageOne.incorrectAnswer: Researchers will download the study data which includes a copy of your data.

pageTwo.title: What kind of research can be done with my study data?
pageTwo.correctAnswer: Correct! Your study data can be used for all kinds of research, including commercial (for profit) research.
pageTwo.incorrectAnswer: Your study data can be used for all kinds of research, including commercial (for profit) research.

armTwo.title: How will your study data be used?
armTwo.subTitle: You and other participants get to vote how researchers can access and use your data.
armTwo.subText1: Researchers will only view your data on a secure server - they cannot download your data.
armTwo.subText2: Before researchers can use the data, we will tell you the voting results.

pageTwo.correctAnswer: Correct! Researchers will only view your data on a secure server. They cannot download your data.
pageTwo.incorrectAnswer: Researchers will only view your data on a secure server. They cannot download your data.

pageThree.title: How will researchers use your data?
pageThree.correctAnswer: Correct! Study participants vote to decide how study data is used.
pageThree.incorrectAnswer: Study participants vote to decide how study data is used.

armThree.title: How will your study data be used?
armThree.subTitle: You and other participants get to vote how researchers can use your data.
armThree.subText1: Researchers will download study data from the databank.
armThree.subText2: Before researchers can use the data, we will tell you the voting results.

pageOne.title: How will your study data be used?
pageOne.subText1: You get to choose how researchers access and use your data. We will ask you to make those choices now.

pageTwo.title: How should researchers be allowed to access the study data?
pageTwo.subTitle: Choose the option that you want us to use.

pageThree.title: Who controls your data? Choose the option that you want used for your data.

pageFour.title: Would you like to volunteer for the community review panel?

pageOne.title: Now let’s vote!
pageOne.subText1: It’s time for you to tell us how you feel the study data should be used.
pageOne.subText2: Think about your data and then choose your favorite option for each question.

pageTwo.title: Can my data be used by researchers to make a profit?

pageThree.title: Do people have to pay to use my data?

pageFour.title: How can my data be used?

pageFive.title: How can results be shared with participants?

pageSix.title: Voting Confirmation
pageSix.subTitle: Review the list below to confirm this represents your choices.

ranking.title: Voting Screen
ranking.paragraph1: All of the people who join the study will get to vote on how the data is used. Now is the time for you to cast your ballot.
ranking.paragraph2: We are asking you to do rank choice voting. This means ordering the statements below from your top choice (most preferred) to your bottom choice (least preferred).
ranking.paragraph3: Based on how all the people in the study vote, the top items will be the rules for the databank.
ranking.paragraph4: If there is disagreement between two items, only the top-most will be used. For example, if the second highest voted item is: “No one can use this data to make a profit” and the third highest voted item is: “Anyone can use this data and make a profit” we will not let researchers use the data to make a profit.
ranking.paragraph5: Order the statements below from most preferred (top) to least preferred (bottom) Tap an item to select it and use the arrow buttons to move.
ranking.review: Review the list below to confirm this represents your choices.

pageOne.risk1: Answering mental health questions could be tiring, frustrating, boring, or make you feel uncomfortable
pageOne.risk2: We will do our best to keep your information safe, but your data could be hacked. We will tell you if this happens.
pageOne.risk3: If we learn of any risks that might change your mind about taking part in this study we will tell you.
pageOne.benefit1: You may not personally benefit from taking part in this study.
pageOne.benefit2: Thinking about your mental health may help you better understand yourself.
pageOne.benefit3: You may help researchers better understand how young adults can manage their mental health.

pageTwo.description:
The time you use on this app may count against your mobile data plan. You can set up the app to use Wi-Fi instead. 

You will not be paid for participating in this study. 

You will not be paid for sharing your data.

pageThree.description1:
This is a research study. It is NOT treatment for mental health. 

 We will not monitor the MindKind Study App in real time. 

If you experience a mental health crisis, contact a doctor or mental health care provider directly.
pageThree.description2:
are available on the study website. 

If you have questions about the study, you can reach us by email at:

pageFour.title: What is the purpose of this study?
pageFour.answer: The purpose of this study is to participate in research.

pageFive.description2: You may leave this study at any time for any reason.
pageFive.description3: If you withdraw, you can ask us to delete all of your study data.
pageFive.description4: If you withdraw without asking us to delete your data, we will continue to use data already collected but will not collect any new data from you.

pageSeven.description:
If you have questions you can reach us by email at MindKindSupport@sagebionetworks.org. 

We may want to reach out to you in the future. You can opt out of these follow-up notifications at any time.

pageEight.description1: The purpose of the MindKind Study is to understand whether, and how, young adults are willing to use a mobile App to self-manage and share their data regarding their mental health.
pageEight.description2: I can choose whether or not to participate. If I choose to participate, I can change my mind at any time.
pageEight.description3: This is a research study, not medical care. My responses will not be monitored in real time.
pageEight.description4: I am not expected to personally benefit from the study.
pageEight.description5: I will use the MindKind Study App to respond to questions about my mental health and wellbeing and can contribute data directly from my phone.
pageEight.description6: My information will be transferred to the United States and stored securely.
pageEight.description7: Researchers will use my information for research. If I give my permission, they may share data with other researchers for future research.
pageEight.description8: I have read and considered the risks of participating in this study. The Research Institution may contact me to update my research record or to invite me to participate in other studies.
pageEight.description9: I can contact the study team with any questions or concerns related to the MindKind Study.

research.subtitle1: The team doing this research is from India, South Africa, the UK, and USA. A non-profit called Sage Bionetworks (USA) is leading the study. The Wellcome Trust (UK) is funding the study.

youthAdvisor.title: Professional Youth Advisor
youthAdvisor.description1: Refiloe is an undergraduate student at the University of South Africa (UNISA) studying Information Science. She works with the team at Higher Health as the Professional Youth Advisor for the MindKind study in South Africa. She is passionate about mental health being prioritized in all structures as she has experienced and lived with anxiety during her full-time studies at the University of Johannesburg and hopes that her current studies and occupation will enable her to be an effective leader in the ethical use, organization, and management of mental health information from young people.
youthAdvisor.description2: Swetha works with the team at the Centre for Mental Health Law and Policy as the Professional Youth Advisor for the MindKind Study in India. She holds a Masters in the Psychology of Mental Health from the University of Edinburgh. Swetha is deeply passionate about providing accessible mental health care to vulnerable and marginalised communities and would like to grow and expand her knowledge about stigma and discrimination as barriers of the same.
youthAdvisor.description3: Emily works with the Child and Adolescent Psychiatry team at the University of Oxford as the Professional Youth Advisor for the MindKind Study in the UK. Her passion for mental health originated from personal experiences of anxiety since school. Because of these experiences, she is keen to bridge the gap between researchers and young people – both to improve research, but also so that she can use her experience in this role as a non-academic to make research more accessible to the demographics it effects.

dataRegulation.title: General Data Protection Regulation Addendum
dataRegulation.gdpr1: As required by law under the General Data Protection Regulation, additional information is being provided to you as a research participant.
dataRegulation.gdpr2: For the purpose of the law in your region, particularly the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR), the legal basis for the collection and use of your data is your consent as well as the public interest in the research being conducted.
dataRegulation.gdpr3: If you are habitually located in an area that abides by the General Data Protection Regulation, you have certain rights related to the processing of the information we collect from you.  While some of these rights apply generally, certain rights apply only in certain limited circumstances.  We will comply with your request to exercise your rights unless we have compelling legitimate grounds to deny your request or we cannot comply with your request for legal reasons. We will respond to your request within 1 month of receiving it.
dataRegulation.rights1: You have the right to access your data. You can write to us at any time asking to know what personal information is being held where and for what purpose.
dataRegulation.rights2: You have the right to rectification. If there is an error in the information we collect from you, you have the right to make a request to have it fixed. You can write to us to ask for any incorrect personal data about you to be corrected.
dataRegulation.rights3: You have the right to erasure. You may ask us to delete or remove some or all of your personal data at any time.
dataRegulation.rights4: You have the right to restrict processing. At any time, you can withdraw your consent to our processing of your Personal Data.
dataRegulation.rights5: You have the right to data portability. You can request a copy of your data in usable format.
dataRegulation.rights6: You have the right to object. You can withdraw from providing data to the App at any time.
dataRegulation.emailText: If you have questions about your rights and choices or would like more information about your rights and choices, you can email:

privacyPolicy.title: Privacy Policy
privacyPolicy.text1: Sage Bionetworks (“Sage Bionetworks, “we,” or “us”) is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit biomedical research organization in the United States, created to enhance how researchers approach the complexity of human biological information and the treatment of disease. We have developed a website and mobile application (the “MindKind website” and “MindKind Study App”) to facilitate our MindKind research study (the “Study”). We want to find out if young adults are willing to use a mobile application (the MindKind Study App) to record their mental health. We also want to find out what data youth are willing to share for research and how. This information will help us determine whether data collected via the MindKind Study App can be used to create a global research databank about Mental Health. The Study and the MindKind Study App are designed for users who’ve reached legal age (set between 16 and 21 depending on local laws) and live in a country where the MindKind Study App is available.
privacyPolicy.text2: Your privacy is important to us. The Privacy Label gives you an overview of Sage’s privacy practices within the MindKind Website and MindKind Study App. To learn more, read the detailed policy linked below.

collection.question1: Do we collect sensitive categories of data, like health information?
collection.question2: Do we collect passive data from your device?
collection.question3: Do we access your contacts, photos or other personal information stored on your phone?

tracking.question3: Do we track your precise device location?
tracking.question4: Do we track your browsing activites on other Apps?
tracking.question5: Do we listen to you using your device microphone?
tracking.question6: Do we watch you using your device camera?

useAndSharing.question2: Do we share your personal information with others?
useAndSharing.question3: Do we share your de-identified aggregate information?
useAndSharing.question4: Do we use your data for advertising?
useAndSharing.question5: Do we transfer/store your data abroad?

communication.question2: Do we send you push notifications?

consent.title: Consent
consent.description: Before joining the MindKind Study, we will ask for your consent. We want you to understand the study, your role, and the protection and use of your data.  Once you know more about the study you can decide whether you want to participate. You may change your mind at any time.
consent.description2: You can learn more about the study from the consent documents provided below.
consent.approvals: This study has been reviewed and approved by the research ethics committees of the participating institutions.

about.title: About the study
about.paragraph1: Some of us know exactly what we need for emotional health. Others of us are still figuring it out. Wherever you are in that process, your experience could help others.
about.paragraph2: We’d like your help to design a databank that will collect information about emotional health from young people. You would help us decide what types of information to collect, who controls the databank, and who gets to use it. We’re inviting people like you from around the world to share their knowledge.
about.makeDifference: Want to start your MindKind journey?

thing1.title: MindKind Study
thing1.text: This is a research study and does not provide medical advice, diagnosis, or treatment.
thing1.text2: from around the world lead the MindKind Study.

thing2.title: Our Goal
thing2.text: The goal of the study is to learn how best to design a databank – a pool of data – about emotional health experiences from youth from around the world.

thing3.title: Why you?
thing3.text: In this study, we will learn about what data youth do and don’t want to add to the databank. How would youth want the data they add to the pool to be shared and used by researchers? What keeps youth engaged?

thing4.title: Who can join?
thing4.text: You can join the study if you meet ALL of the following: Are ages 16-24 from the UK or ages 18-24 from India and South Africa. Have an Android phone. Live in the UK, India, or South Africa. Can read English.

thing5.title: MindKind Study App
thing5.text: If you join, you will use a free app to answer questions about your emotional health. It will take about 15-20 minutes each week. We hope you will participate for 12 weeks.

thing6.title: Your Phone Number
thing6.text: We need your phone number to link your account on the MindKind Study App to your consent form. We will not use your phone number for any other purpose.

thing7.title: Stop Any Time
thing7.text: You can leave the MindKind Study at any time. Let us know. We will give you instructions about how to turn off the MindKind Study App. We will also ask you about why you are leaving, but you don’t have to tell us.

thing8.title: Safety/Ethics
thing8.text: We will use your data for research. We will remove your name andreplace it with a random code. This protects your identity. We will move your data to the USA. We will store it on secure servers. We may ask you if scientists who are not on this study team can use your data for research. You can say yes or no.

thing9.title: Your Data
thing9.text: You may request a copy of your study data and use it as you like.

readyToJoin.title: Ready to join?
readyToJoin.text: Review the consent for the MindKind Study. If you want to join, sign the consent. Next, download the free study app, create an account, and start sharing your experience to help others.

terms.title: Terms of Service
terms.mindkindStudy1: The MindKind Study website is where you can learn about the project and enroll in the study. The MindKind Study participant app is where enrolled individuals can participate in the MindKind Study (MindKind).
terms.mindkindStudy2: Sage Bionetworks (2901 3rd Ave #330, Seattle, WA 98121) provides the study website and participant app. These are the Terms of Service for the website and participant app provided by Sage Bionetworks. By using the website and/or participant app, you acknowledge that you have read, understood, and will comply with the terms of this agreement.
terms.whoCanUse: Who can use the MindKind Study website and participant app?
terms.whoCanUse1: Anyone can access the MindKind Study website
terms.whoCanUse2: You must be 18 years old (16 in the United Kingdom) to use the MindKind participant app.
terms.siteAndAppTitle: The study website and participant app
terms.siteAndAppText: Sage Bionetworks and its collaborators own the technology framework (the code and infrastructure) of the study website and participant app. The technology framework of the website and participant app are their intellectual property (IP). Here are rules about that IP:
terms.siteAndAppRules1: Do not try to misuse any part of the website or participant app. This means:
terms.siteAndAppRules1-1: Follow the instructions about how to use them.
terms.siteAndAppRules2: Do not try to change or delete any part of the website or participant app.
terms.siteAndAppRules2-1: Do not remove, hide, or change any legal information or notices about the website or participant app.
terms.siteAndAppRules3: Do not download any portion of the website or participant app without written permission.
terms.siteAndAppRules4: Do not access, download, change or in any way misuse study data collected through the website or study app.
terms.siteAndAppRules5: Sage Bionetworks can stop giving you access to the website or participant app at any time for any reason. They don't have to give you any notice.
terms.siteAndAppRules6: Over time, Sage Bionetworks may improve the website and or participant app.They may add new features or delete ones that are available right now.
terms.siteAndAppRules7: Sage Bionetworks is providing the website and the participant app. They do not make any guarantees, claims, or warranties to you about the way that the website or participant app work.
terms.siteAndAppRules8: Sage Bionetworks is not responsible for the type or quality of information in the website or participant app.
terms.siteAndAppRules9: Do not use any of the logos or branding found on the website or participant app without permission.
terms.yourAccess: Your Access to the MindKind Study Participant App
terms.yourAccessRules: The MindKind Study participant app is meant for individuals who have consented to participate in the MindKind Study. Here are the rules for the MindKind Study participant app:
terms.yourAccessRules1: Only use the MindKind participant app if you have consented to participate in the MindKind Study, or with express permission.
terms.yourAccessRules2: Only consented participants are allowed to use the participant app.
terms.yourAccessRules2-1: Keep your participant app and login information private and secure.
terms.yourAccessRules2-2: If you think someone else has used your participant app without your permission, contact us at MindKindSupport@sagebionetworks.org.
terms.yourAccessRules3: Sage Bionetworks can stop giving you access to the participant app at any time for any reason.
terms.yourAccessRules3-1: They don't have to give you any notice.
terms.yourAccessRules3-2: They may delete or remove your information.
terms.yourAccessRules4: Sage Bionetworks can stop giving you access to the MindKind participant app if you violate the terms of service.
terms.yourAccessRules4-1: If Sage Bionetworks blocks service because you violate the terms of this agreement, you are prohibited from accessing the study app.
terms.yourAccessRules5: You can stop using or delete your account at any time.
terms.yourAccessRules5-1: Deleting the participant app is not the same as withdrawing from MindKind Study. Deleting the participant app will only delete the data stored on your mobile device.
terms.yourAccessRules5-2: Unless you withdraw and specifically request that your data be deleted, MindKind Study researchers, and Sage Bionetworks will continue to use your data. If you withdraw from the study, no new information will be collected from you via the study app. If you stop using the app but do not withdraw from the study, the app will continue to collect passive information until the end of the study period.
terms.yourAccessRules6: If you want to update any of the data you have provided, contact us at MindKindSupport@sagebionetworks.org
terms.informationUsageTitle: How MindKind Study team can use your information
terms.informationUsageText: Study team can see the information you share on the website and/or on the participant app. Sage Bionetworks and the MindKind Study research team can use this information for limited purposes.
terms.informationUsage1: They are not allowed to sell or rent this information.
terms.informationUsage2: They are allowed to use this information to make sure that the study website and participant app work the way they are supposed to.
terms.informationUsage3: They are allowed to use this information to improve the study website and participant app.
terms.informationUsage4: They are allowed to use this information to make the study website and participant app easier to use.
terms.informationUsage5: They are allowed to use information from the MindKind participant app for research.
terms.informationUsageFeedback: If you share comments, ideas, or feedback with Sage Bionetworks or affiliates about the study website and/or participant app, they can use this information any way they want to. By contacting us, you are allowing us to contact you in response.
terms.notificationsText: Sage Bionetworks may send you announcements, alerts, notifications or other messages about the MindKind study website or MindKind study participant app. You can turn these on or off in settings. No matter what your account settings are, Sage Bionetworks may have to send you a message if it is required by law.
terms.aboutCellPhoneTitle: About accessing the study website or participant app through your cell phone
terms.aboutCellPhoneText: You may be able to access the study website or participant app on your cell phone. Be safe. For example, don't do so while driving a car.
terms.aboutCellPhone1: Sage Bionetworks is not responsible for cell phone data costs or text message charges.
terms.feesAndDisputes1: Sage Bionetworks is not responsible for any lost profit, revenue, or data because of your decision to participate in the MindKind Study.
terms.feesAndDisputes2: Sage Bionetworks is not responsible for financial losses or damages of any kind as a result of using the study website or participant app.
terms.feesAndDisputes3: If you have a dispute with Sage Bionetworks or any part of the study website or participant app, you promise to contact Sage Bionetworks and try to resolve the dispute in good faith.
terms.feesAndDisputes4: You cannot sue Sage Bionetworks, or any MindKind collaborator, in the case that the study website and/or participant app do not work the way you expect.
terms.feesAndDisputes5: Other parties cannot sue Sage Bionetworks, or any MindKind collaborator on your behalf if the website and/or participant app do not work the way you or they expect.
terms.updatesToTermsTitle: Updates to these Terms of Service
terms.updatesToTermsText: Sage Bionetworks may update these Terms of Service. They will post any updates on this webpage. If they make major changes, they will try to tell you directly. For example, Sage Bionetworks may send you a notification or post the change. If you take part in the MindKind Study or use the website or participant app after they update the Terms of Service, it means you agree to the updated Terms of Service.
terms.notMedicalCareText: The MindKind Study website and participant app are not for medical care, advice, or treatment. If you need medical care, advice, or treatment, you should see a healthcare provider. Do not use the website or participant app in place of seeing a healthcare provider.
terms.otherPoliciesText: In addition to the Terms of Service, there are other important policies about the MindKind Study.
terms.otherPolicies1: The MindKind Study Privacy Policy says what information we will collect through the website and participant app. It also says what we will do with this data. You can read it here (Link to privacy policy).
terms.contactText: If you have any questions, comments or requests, please contact us at MindKindSupport@sagebionetworks.org
terms.versionsText: Here is a list of the versions of these Terms of Service

download.title: Thank you for joining!
download.description1: Now that you are enrolled you can start using the MindKind Study App to record your daily mental and emotional health.
download.compensationText: If you would like to receive compensation for this study
